intro: Duroia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed evergreen, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in the humid, shaded conditions of the forest floor. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing structural support and contributing to the dense canopy of the rainforest. Duroia stenophylla plays a vital role in the ecosystem by offering habitat and food for various forest organisms.
